message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of hand pose estimation from monochrome images, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a novel technique that involves disentangling the representation of pose from appearance, which is a problem that can be tackled using machine learning techniques such as deep neural networks (cs.LG, cs.AI). The paper also involves generating images of hands using specified pose+appearance features, which is a topic in graphics (cs.GR) and multimedia (cs.MM). Overall, the paper's focus on hand pose estimation and disentangling pose from appearance makes it most likely to belong to cs.CV, followed by cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, and cs.MM.
